noWalk.title: No options available
noWalk.body: You're driving and using DASH but not willing to walk any distance. Consider adjusting your walk distance to see recommendations.

default.title: Park farther, use DASH for last mile
default.body: Park in a less crowded area and take the free DASH shuttle to get closer to your destination.

steps.title: Park farther from destination
steps.description: Find parking away from the destination where spots are easier to find. Look for areas with less competition.

steps.title: Take the DASH shuttle
steps.description: Walk to the nearest DASH stop and board the free downtown shuttle. Ride it to get closer to your destination.

noWalk.title: No options available
noWalk.body: You're driving and taking transit but not willing to walk any distance. Consider adjusting your walk distance to see recommendations.

default.title: Park at Rapid stop, take transit
default.body: Park near a Rapid transit stop and take the bus to get closer to your destination.

steps.title: Park near a Rapid stop
steps.description: Find parking near a Rapid transit stop. This area will have more available parking.

steps.title: Board The Rapid
steps.description: Walk to the Rapid stop and board the bus. Ride to a stop that's within walking distance of your destination.
steps.linkText: View transit route on Google Maps

noWalk.title: No options available
noWalk.body: You're driving and using micromobility but not willing to walk any distance. Consider adjusting your walk distance to see recommendations.

default.title: Park farther, use Lime for last mile
default.body: Park in a less crowded area and use a Lime scooter or bike for the final stretch.

steps.title: Park farther from destination
steps.description: Find parking away from the destination where spots are easier to find. Look for areas with less competition.

steps.title: Find and ride a Lime scooter or bike
steps.description: Open the Lime app and locate the nearest available scooter or bike. Unlock it and ride directly to your destination.

noWalk.title: No options available
noWalk.body: You're driving but not willing to walk any distance. Consider adjusting your walk distance to see recommendations.

noCost.title: No options available
noCost.body: Parking meters are enforced Monday-Friday 8am-7pm. Since you're not willing to pay for parking, there are no options available during enforcement hours.

meteredParking.title: Park at metered street parking
meteredParking.body: Park at street meters near the arena ($1.25-$2.00 per half hour, typically 2-3 hour max). Meters are enforced Monday-Friday 8am-7pm.

steps.title: Find metered parking
steps.description: Look for parking meters on streets surrounding Van Andel Arena: Fulton Street, Ionia Avenue, Ottawa Avenue, Monroe Avenue, Pearl Street, and Louis Street. Meters are typically available within 0.2 miles of the arena.

steps.title: Pay for parking
steps.description: Pay using the Motu (Mobile GR) app, or at the meter using cash, credit/debit card, or mobile payment. Rates are $1.25-$2.00 per half hour in prime areas ($2.50-$4.00 per hour). Maximum duration is typically 2-3 hours (varies by location).

steps.title: Walk to destination
steps.description: Walk from your parking spot.

alternate.title: Find free street parking
alternate.body: Spend 15 minutes in traffic circling the area to find free street parking. Meters are not enforced on weekends (free all day), and free on weekdays before 8am and after 7pm.

steps.title: Spend 15 minutes in traffic looking for free street parking
steps.description: Circle the blocks looking for free street parking. Meters are not enforced on weekends (free all day), and free on weekdays before 8am and after 7pm. Enforcement hours are Monday-Friday 8am-7pm. Be aware of odd-even parking restrictions from November 1 to April 1. This may take 15+ minutes of driving in traffic.

steps.title: Park and walk
steps.description: Once you find a spot, park and walk.

affordableLot.title: Park at affordable surface lot and walk
affordableLot.body: Park at a surface parking lot (around $8-$10 for 4 hours) within {walkMiles} miles and walk the rest of the way. Surface lots are cheaper than ramps (structured parking garages).

steps.title: Find affordable surface parking lot
steps.description: Look for surface parking lots near Ottawa and Fulton streets, or Market Street Lot. Surface lots are open-air parking areas (not garages) and typically cost $8-$10 for 4 hours, cheaper than ramps.

steps.title: Park and walk
steps.description: Park your car and walk up to {walkMiles} miles.

alternate.title: Find free street parking
alternate.body: Spend 15 minutes in traffic circling the area to find free street parking. Meters are not enforced on weekends (free all day), and free on weekdays before 8am and after 7pm.

steps.title: Spend 15 minutes in traffic looking for free street parking
steps.description: Circle the blocks looking for free street parking. Meters are not enforced on weekends (free all day), and free on weekdays before 8am and after 7pm. Enforcement hours are Monday-Friday 8am-7pm. Be aware of odd-even parking restrictions from November 1 to April 1. This may take 15+ minutes of driving in traffic.

steps.title: Park and walk
steps.description: Once you find a spot, park and walk up to {walkMiles} miles.

freeStreet.title: Find free street parking
freeStreet.body: Spend 15 minutes in traffic circling the area to find free street parking. Meters are free after 7 PM on weekdays and all day on weekends.

steps.title: Spend 15 minutes in traffic looking for free street parking
steps.description: Circle the blocks looking for free street parking. Meters are not enforced on weekends (free all day), and free on weekdays before 8am and after 7pm. Enforcement hours are Monday-Friday 8am-7pm. Be aware of odd-even parking restrictions from November 1 to April 1. This may take 15+ minutes of driving in traffic.

steps.title: Park and walk
steps.description: Once you find a spot, park and walk up to {walkMiles} miles.

cheaperGarage.title: Park at city parking garage
cheaperGarage.body: Park at a city-owned parking garage (Monroe Center Ramp or Ottawa-Fulton Ramp) for $1.50 per hour, max $12. These are affordable structured garages within 0.2-0.3 miles of the arena.

steps.title: Park at Monroe Center Ramp or Ottawa-Fulton Ramp
steps.description: Monroe Center Ramp (25 Monroe Center NW) is 0.3 miles from Van Andel Arena. Ottawa-Fulton Ramp (50 Ottawa Ave NW) is 0.2 miles away. Both charge $1.50 per hour with a maximum of $12. These city-owned garages offer good availability and are more affordable than premium ramps.

steps.title: Walk to destination
steps.description: Walk from the garage (0.2-0.3 miles).

alternate.title: Park at affordable surface lot
alternate.body: Park at a surface parking lot (around $8-$10 for 4 hours) within {walkMiles} miles and walk the rest of the way. Surface lots are cheaper than garages but fill up quickly.

steps.title: Find affordable surface parking lot
steps.description: Look for surface parking lots near Ottawa and Fulton streets, or Market Street Lot. Surface lots are open-air parking areas (not garages) and typically cost $8-$10 for 4 hours.

steps.title: Park and walk
steps.description: Park your car and walk up to {walkMiles} miles.

premiumRamp.title: Park at premium parking garage
premiumRamp.body: Park at a premium ramp (structured parking garage) close by (around $27-$30 for evening/events) for convenient access. Premium ramps like Arena Place Garage are directly across from the arena and often have better availability because people avoid the higher cost.

steps.title: Park at Arena Place Garage or Studio Park Ramp
steps.description: Arena Place Garage (130 Ionia Ave SW) is directly across from Van Andel Arena. Studio Park Ramp (123 Ionia Ave SW) is 0.1 miles away. Both are premium ramps operated by Ellis Parking, typically costing $27-$30 for evening/events (daytime max $27). These structured parking garages often have better availability because people avoid the higher cost.

steps.title: Walk to destination
steps.description: Walk from the garage (0-0.1 miles).

alternate.title: Find free street parking
alternate.body: Spend 15 minutes in traffic circling the area to find free street parking. Meters are not enforced on weekends (free all day), and free on weekdays before 8am and after 7pm.

steps.title: Spend 15 minutes in traffic looking for free street parking
steps.description: Circle the blocks looking for free street parking. Meters are not enforced on weekends (free all day), and free on weekdays before 8am and after 7pm. Enforcement hours are Monday-Friday 8am-7pm. Be aware of odd-even parking restrictions from November 1 to April 1. This may take 15+ minutes of driving in traffic.

steps.title: Park and walk
steps.description: Once you find a spot, park and walk.

noCost.title: No options available
noCost.body: The Rapid fare is $1.75. Consider adjusting your budget to see recommendations.

noWalk.title: No options available
noWalk.body: You're taking The Rapid and using DASH but not willing to walk any distance. Consider adjusting your walk distance to see recommendations.

default.title: Take Rapid, then DASH
default.body: Ride The Rapid to downtown, then use the free DASH shuttle to get closer to your destination.

steps.title: Board The Rapid
steps.description: Go to your nearest Rapid stop and board the bus. Ride to a downtown stop that's near a DASH connection point.
steps.linkText: View transit route on Google Maps

steps.title: Transfer to DASH
steps.description: Get off The Rapid and walk to the nearest DASH stop. Board the free DASH shuttle and ride it closer to your destination.

steps.title: Walk to destination
steps.description: Get off the DASH shuttle and walk the remaining distance to your destination.

noCost.title: No options available
noCost.body: The Rapid fare is $1.75. Consider adjusting your budget to see recommendations.

noWalk.title: No options available
noWalk.body: You're taking The Rapid but not willing to walk any distance. Consider adjusting your walk distance to see recommendations.

default.title: The Rapid + short walk
default.body: Plan your route to a Rapid stop near your destination. Avoid transfers if possible. After getting off, walk the remaining distance.

steps.title: Take The Rapid
steps.description: Go to your nearest Rapid stop and board the bus. Ride to a stop near your destination. Avoid transfers if possible.
steps.linkText: View transit route on Google Maps

steps.title: Walk to destination
steps.description: Get off The Rapid and walk the remaining distance to your destination.

noCost.title: No options available
noCost.body: Rideshare services typically cost at least $10. Consider adjusting your budget to see recommendations.

default.title: Request a rideshare to your destination
default.body: Request an Uber or Lyft and get dropped off at your destination.

steps.title: Request an Uber/Lyft
steps.description: Open your Uber or Lyft app and request a ride. Set your destination and confirm the ride.

steps.title: Arrive at destination
steps.description: Wait for your driver to arrive, then ride to your destination. The driver will drop you off as close as possible.

noCost.title: No options available
noCost.body: Lime typically costs at least $4. Consider adjusting your budget to see recommendations.

default.title: Find and ride a Lime scooter or bike
default.body: Open the Lime app and find the nearest available scooter or bike. Unlock it and ride directly to your destination.

steps.title: Find a Lime scooter or bike
steps.description: Open the Lime app and locate the nearest available scooter or bike near your starting location.

steps.title: Ride to destination
steps.description: Unlock the scooter or bike and ride directly to your destination.

noWalk.title: No options available
noWalk.body: You're using DASH but not willing to walk any distance. Consider adjusting your walk distance to see recommendations.

default.title: Take the DASH shuttle
default.body: Use the free DASH downtown shuttle to get closer to your destination, then walk the remaining distance.

steps.title: Find a DASH stop
steps.description: Locate the nearest DASH shuttle stop near your starting location.

steps.title: Board the DASH shuttle
steps.description: Wait for the next DASH shuttle and board it. The shuttle is free and runs through downtown Grand Rapids.

steps.title: Walk to destination
steps.description: Get off the DASH shuttle at a stop near your destination and walk the remaining distance.

default.title: Bike to your destination and lock up nearby
default.body: Ride your bike to your destination. Find a bike rack or secure post near the entrance to lock up. This avoids parking entirely.

steps.title: Ride your bike to destination
steps.description: Ride your bike to your destination.

steps.title: Lock up your bike
steps.description: Find a bike rack or secure post near the entrance and lock up your bike.

linkTexts.viewTransitRoute: View transit route on Google Maps

premiumRamps.name: Arena Place Garage
premiumRamps.address: 130 Ionia Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
premiumRamps.distance: Directly across from Van Andel Arena
premiumRamps.availability: Often better availability due to higher cost

premiumRamps.name: Studio Park Ramp
premiumRamps.address: 123 Ionia Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

cityGarages.name: Monroe Center Ramp
cityGarages.address: 25 Monroe Center NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

cityGarages.name: Ottawa-Fulton Ramp
cityGarages.address: 50 Ottawa Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

areas: Fulton Street (east and west of arena)
Ionia Avenue (north and south of arena)

pricing.rate: $1.25-$2.00 per half hour in prime areas
pricing.free: After 5pm or 6pm and on weekends (event rates may apply)

meteredParking.payment: Motu (Mobile GR) app, cash, credit/debit cards, mobile payment apps
meteredParking.availability: Limited during events, better availability on weekdays
meteredParking.operator: City of Grand Rapids - Motu (Mobile GR)
meteredParking.note: No free street parking available within 0.5 miles of Van Andel Arena during enforcement hours

notes.premiumRamps: Premium ramps like Arena Place often have better availability because people avoid the higher cost ($27-$30). These are the most convenient options with structured parking, located directly across from or very close to Van Andel Arena.
notes.cityGarages: City parking garages offer more affordable rates ($1.50/hour, max $12) and are good alternatives to premium ramps. They're typically 0.2-0.3 miles from Van Andel Arena and provide structured parking at a lower cost.
notes.surfaceLots: Surface lots are affordable ($8-$10 for 4 hours) but fill up quickly, especially during events. They require more walking distance (0.2-0.5 miles from the arena).
notes.meteredParking: Street meters (Motu/Mobile GR) are the most affordable paid option ($1.25-$2.00 per half hour, $2.50-$4.00 per hour) but have time limits (typically 2-3 hours) and limited availability during events. Meters are enforced Monday-Friday 8am-7pm, free after 5pm or 6pm and on weekends (event rates may apply). No free street parking is available within 0.5 miles of Van Andel Arena during enforcement hours.
